name: equinix
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing equinix cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`equinix` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/equinix/terraform-provider-equinix).

authToken.description: The Equinix Metal API auth key for API operations

clientId.description: API Consumer Key available under My Apps section in developer portal

clientSecret.description: API Consumer secret available under My Apps section in developer portal

endpoint.description: The Equinix API base URL to point out desired environment. Defaults to https://api.equinix.com

requestTimeout.description:
The duration of time, in seconds, that the Equinix Platform API Client should wait before canceling an API request.
Defaults to 30

responseMaxPageSize.description: The maximum number of records in a single response for REST queries that produce paginated responses

token.description: API token from the developer sandbox

actions.description: One or more pending actions to complete connection provisioning.

authorizationKey.description:
Unique identifier authorizing Equinix to provision a connection
towards a cloud service provider. If not specified primary `authorization_key` will be used. However,
some service providers may require different keys for each connection. More information on
[Equinix Fabric how to guide](https://developer.equinix.com/docs/ecx-how-to-guide).

deviceInterfaceId.description:
Applicable with `device_uuid`, identifier of network interface
on a given device. If not specified then first available interface will be selected.

deviceUuid.description:
Applicable with primary `device_uuid`. Identifier of the Network Edge
virtual device from which the secondary connection would originate. If not specified primary
`device_uuid` will be used.

portUuid.description:
Applicable with primary `port_uuid`. Identifier of the Equinix Fabric Port from
which the secondary connection would originate. If not specified primary `port_uuid` will be used.

profileUuid.description: Unique identifier of the service provider's profile.

providerStatus.description: Connection provisioning status on service provider's side.

redundancyGroup.description: Unique identifier of group containing a primary and secondary connection.

redundancyType.description:
Connection redundancy type, applicable for HA connections. Valid values are
`PRIMARY`, `SECONDARY`.

redundantUuid.description: Unique identifier of the redundant connection, applicable for HA connections.
redundantUuid.deprecationMessage: SecondaryConnection.0.RedundantUUID will not be returned. Use UUID instead

sellerMetroCode.description:
The metro code that denotes the secondary connectionâ€™s
destination (Z side). .

sellerRegion.description:
The region in which the seller port resides. If not specified
primary `seller_region` will be used.

serviceToken.description:
Required with primary `service_token`. Unique Equinix Fabric key
given by a provider that grants you authorization to enable connectivity from an Equinix Fabric Port or
virtual device. Each connection (primary and secondary) requires a separate token.
More details in [Fabric Service Tokens](https://docs.equinix.com/en-us/Content/Interconnection/Fabric/service%20tokens/Fabric-Service-Tokens.htm).

speed.description:
Speed/Bandwidth to be allocated to the secondary connection. If not
specified primary `speed` will be used.

speedUnit.description:
Unit of the speed/bandwidth to be allocated to the secondary
connection. If not specified primary `speed_unit` will be used.

status.description: Connection provisioning status on Equinix Fabric side.

vendorToken.description:
The Equinix Fabric Token the connection was created with. Applicable if the
connection was created with a `service_token` (a-side) or `zside_service_token` (z-side).
* `secondary_connection`:
* `zside_port_uuid`
* `zside_vlan_stag`
* `zside_vlan_ctag`
* `redundancy_type`
* `redundancy_group`
* `vendor_token`

vlanCtag.description:
Applicable with `port_uuid`. C-Tag/Inner-Tag of the secondary
connection, a numeric character ranging from 2 - 4094.

vlanStag.description:
S-Tag/Outer-Tag of the secondary connection, a
numeric character ranging from 2 - 4094.

zsidePortUuid.description:
Unique identifier of the port on the remote/destination side
(z-side). Allows you to connect between your own ports or virtual devices across your company's
Equinix Fabric deployment, with no need for a private service profile.

zsideVlanCtag.description:
C-Tag/Inner-Tag of the connection on the remote/destination
side (z-side) - a numeric character ranging from 2 - 4094.
`secondary_connection` is defined it will internally use same `zside_vlan_ctag` for the secondary
connection.

zsideVlanStag.description:
S-Tag/Outer-Tag of the connection on the remote/destination
side (z-side) - a numeric character ranging from 2 - 4094.

allowRemoteConnections.description:
Indicates whether or not connections to this profile
can be created from remote metro locations.

testProfile.description:
Indicates whether or not this profile can be used for test
connections.
testProfile.deprecationMessage: TestProfile is no longer required and will be removed in a future release

metroCode.description: The metro code of location where the port resides.

speed.description: Speed/bandwidth supported by this service profile.

speedUnit.description:
Unit of the speed/bandwidth supported by this service profile. One of
`MB`, `GB`.

dataType.description:
Data type of additional information attribute. One of `BOOLEAN`, `INTEGER` or
`STRING`.

description.description: Textual description of additional information attribute.

mandatory.description:
Specifies if additional information is mandatory to create
connection.

ibxes.description: List of IBXes supported within given metro.

regions.description: List of regions supported within given.

virtualCircuitIds.description: List of IDs of virtual cicruits attached to this port.

expiresAt.description: Expiration date of the service token.

maxAllowedSpeed.description: Maximum allowed speed for the service token, string like in the `speed` attribute.

md5Enabled.description: Whether BGP session is password enabled.

md5Password.description: BGP session password in plaintext (not a checksum).

multihop.description: Whether the neighbor is in EBGP multihop session.

peerAs.description: Peer AS number (different than customer_as for EBGP).

peerIps.description: Array of IP addresses of this neighbor's peers.

routesOuts.description: Array of outgoing routes in the same format.

cidr.description: Bit length of the network mask of the address.

public.description: Whether the address is routable from the Internet.

bonded.description: Whether this port is part of a bond in bonded network setup.

id.description: ID of the port.

mac.description: MAC address assigned to the port.

plan.description: Device plan that must be available in selected location.

quantity.description:
Minimun number of devices that must be available in selected location.
Default is `1`.

Minimun number of devices that must be available in selected location.
Default is `1`.

country.description: Two letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2), e.g. US.

all.description: If is set to true, the values are joined with an AND, and the requests returns only the results that match all specified values. Default is `false`.

attribute.description: The attribute used to filter. Filter attributes are case-sensitive

matchBy.description: The type of comparison to apply. One of: `in` , `re`, `substring`, `less_than`, `less_than_or_equal`, `greater_than`, `greater_than_or_equal`. Default is `in`.

values.description: The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR by default, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values

id.description: id of the plan

name.description:
name of the plan
- `slug`- plan slug
- `description`- description of the plan
- `line`- plan line, e.g. baremetal
- `legacy`- flag showing if it's a legacy plan
- `class`- plan class
- `pricing_hour`- plan hourly price
- `pricing_month`- plan monthly price
- `deployment_types`- list of deployment types, e.g. on_demand, spot_market
- `available_in`- list of facilities where the plan is available
- `available_in_metros`- list of facilities where the plan is available

attribute.description: The attribute used to filter. Filter attributes are case-sensitive

direction.description: Sort results in ascending or descending order. Strings are sorted in alphabetical order. One of: asc, desc

asn.description: Autonomous System Number for local BGP deployment.

maxPrefix.description: The maximum number of route filters allowed per server.

md5.description: Password for BGP session in plaintext (not a checksum).

status.description: Status of BGP configuration in the project.

interfaces.description:
List of device interfaces
* `interface.#.id` - interface identifier
* `interface.#.name` - interface name
* `interface.#.status` -  interface status (AVAILABLE, RESERVED, ASSIGNED)
* `interface.#.operational_status` - interface operational status (up or down)
* `interface.#.mac_address` - interface MAC address
* `interface.#.ip_address` - interface IP address
* `interface.#.assigned_type` - interface management type (Equinix Managed or empty)
* `interface.#.type` - interface type

List of UUIDs of IP block reservations
from which the public IPv4 address should be taken.

deprovisionFast.description:
Whether the OS disk should be filled with `00h` bytes before reinstall.
Defaults to `false`.

enabled.description:
Whether the provider should favour reinstall over destroy and create. Defaults to
`false`.

preserveData.description:
Whether the non-OS disks should be kept or wiped during reinstall.
Defaults to `false`.

`private` or `public`, the `private` is likely to be usable immediately, the
`public` will need to be reviewed by Equinix Metal engineers.

locked.description: Blocks deletion of the SpotMarketRequest device until the lock is disabled.

Device ACL provisioning status where template was applied. One of `PROVISIONING`,

dstPort.description:
Inbound traffic destination ports. Allowed values are a comma separated

authorizationKey.description:
Unique identifier authorizing Equinix to provision a connection
towards a cloud service provider. At Equinix, an `Authorization Key` is a generic term and is NOT
encrypted on Equinix Fabric. Cloud Service Providers might use a different name to refer to this
key such as `Service Key` or `Authentication Key`. Value depends on a provider service profile,
more information on [Equinix Fabric how to guide](https://developer.equinix.com/docs/ecx-how-to-guide).

notifications.

Unique identifier authorizing Equinix to provision a connection
towards a cloud service provider. At Equinix, an `Authorization Key` is a generic term and is NOT
encrypted on Equinix Fabric. Cloud Service Providers might use a different name to refer to this
key such as `Service Key` or `Authentication Key`. Value depends on a provider service profile,
more information on [Equinix Fabric how to guide](https://developer.equinix.com/docs/ecx-how-to-guide).

deviceInterfaceId.description:
Applicable with `device_uuid`, identifier of network interface
on a given device, used for a connection. If not specified then first available interface will be
selected.

deviceUuid.description:
Unique identifier of
the Network Edge virtual device from which the connection would originate.

namedTag.description:
The type of peering to set up when connecting to Azure Express Route.
Valid values: `PRIVATE`, `MICROSOFT`, `MANUAL`\*, `PUBLIC`\*.

notifications.description:
A list of email addresses used for sending connection update
notifications.

portUuid.description:
Unique identifier of
the Equinix Fabric Port from which the connection would originate.

profileUuid.description: Unique identifier of the service provider's profile.

providerStatus.description: Connection provisioning status on service provider's side.

purchaseOrderNumber.description: Connection's purchase order number to reflect on the invoice

redundancyGroup.description: Unique identifier of group containing a primary and secondary connection.

redundancyType.description:
Connection redundancy type, applicable for HA connections. Valid values are
`PRIMARY`, `SECONDARY`.

redundantUuid.description: Unique identifier of the redundant connection, applicable for HA connections.

secondaryConnection.description:
Definition of secondary connection for redundant, HA
connectivity. See Secondary Connection below for more details.

sellerMetroCode.description:
The metro code that denotes the connectionâ€™s remote/destination
side (z-side).

sellerRegion.description: The region in which the seller port resides.

serviceToken.description:
- A-side
service tokens authorize you to create a connection from a customer port, which created the token
for you, to a service profile or your own port.
More details in [A-Side Fabric Service Tokens](https://docs.equinix.com/en-us/Content/Interconnection/Fabric/service%20tokens/Fabric-Service-Tokens.htm#:~:text=the%20service%20token.-,A%2DSide%20Service%20Tokens,-If%20you%20want).

speed.description: Speed/Bandwidth to be allocated to the connection.

speedUnit.description: Unit of the speed/bandwidth to be allocated to the connection.

status.description: Connection provisioning status on Equinix Fabric side.

vendorToken.description:
The Equinix Fabric Token the connection was created with. Applicable if the
connection was created with a `service_token` (a-side) or `zside_service_token` (z-side).
* `secondary_connection`:
* `zside_port_uuid`
* `zside_vlan_stag`
* `zside_vlan_ctag`
* `redundancy_type`
* `redundancy_group`
* `vendor_token`

vlanCtag.description:
C-Tag/Inner-Tag of the connection - a numeric character ranging from 2
\- 4094.

vlanStag.description:
S-Tag/Outer-Tag of the connection - a numeric
character ranging from 2 - 4094.

zsidePortUuid.description:
Unique identifier of the port on the remote/destination side
(z-side). Allows you to connect between your own ports or virtual devices across your company's
Equinix Fabric deployment, with no need for a private service profile.

zsideServiceToken.description:
- Z-side
service tokens authorize you to create a connection from your port or virtual device to a customer
port which created the token for you. `zside_service_token` cannot be used with `secondary_connection`.
More details in [Z-Side Fabric Service Tokens](https://docs.equinix.com/en-us/Content/Interconnection/Fabric/service%20tokens/Fabric-Service-Tokens.htm#:~:text=requirements%20per%20provider.-,Z%2DSide%20Service%20Tokens,-If%20you%20want).

zsideVlanCtag.description:
C-Tag/Inner-Tag of the connection on the remote/destination
side (z-side) - a numeric character ranging from 2 - 4094.
`secondary_connection` is defined it will internally use same `zside_vlan_ctag` for the secondary
connection.

zsideVlanStag.description:
S-Tag/Outer-Tag of the connection on the remote/destination
side (z-side) - a numeric character ranging from 2 - 4094.

This resource can be imported using an existing ID

```sh

```

accessKey.description: Access Key used to accept connection on provider side.

awsConnectionId.description:

applicable for accepter resource with connections to AWS only.

awsProfile.description:
AWS Profile Name for retrieving credentials from.
shared credentials file

connectionId.description: Identifier of Layer 2 connection that will be accepted.

secretKey.description: Secret Key used to accept connection on provider side.

AWS Profile Name for retrieving credentials from.
shared credentials file

connectionId.description: Identifier of Layer 2 connection that will be accepted.

applicable for accepter resource with connections to AWS only.

awsProfile.description:
AWS Profile Name for retrieving credentials from.
shared credentials file

secretKey.description: Secret Key used to accept connection on provider side.

apiIntegration.description:
Boolean value that determines if API integration is enabled. It
allows you to complete connection provisioning in less than five minutes. Without API Integration,
additional manual steps will be required and the provisioning will likely take longer.

authkeyLabel.description:
Name of the authentication key label to be used by the
Authentication Key service. It allows Service Providers with QinQ ports to accept groups of
connections or VLANs from Dot1q customers. This is similar to S-Tag/C-Tag capabilities.

bandwidthAlertThreshold.description:
Specifies the port bandwidth threshold percentage. If
the bandwidth limit is met or exceeded, an alert is sent to the seller.

bandwidthThresholdNotifications.description:
A list of email addresses that will receive
notifications about bandwidth thresholds.

connectionNameLabel.description:
Custom name used for calling a connections
e.g. `circuit`. Defaults to `Connection`.

ctagLabel.description: C-Tag/Inner-Tag label name for the connections.

equinixManagedPortVlan.description:
Applicable when `api_integration` is set to `true`. It
indicates whether the port and VLAN details are managed by Equinix.

features.description:
Block of profile features configuration. See Features below
for more details.

integrationId.description:
Specifies the API integration ID that was provided to the customer
during onboarding. You can validate your API integration ID using the validateIntegrationId API.

name.description:
Name of the service profile. An alpha-numeric 50 characters string which can
include only hyphens and underscores.

oversubscription.description:
You can set an alert for when a percentage of your profile has
been sold. Service providers like to use this functionality to alert them when they need to add
more ports or when they need to create a new service profile. Required with
`oversubscription_allowed`, defaults to `1x`.

oversubscriptionAllowed.description:
Boolean value that determines if, regardless of the
utilization, Equinix Fabric will continue to add connections to your links until we reach the
oversubscription limit. By selecting this service, you acknowledge that you will manage decisions
on when to increase capacity on these link.

ports.description:
One or more definitions of ports residing in locations, from which your
customers will be able to access services using this service profile. See Port below for
more details.

private.description:
Boolean value that indicates whether or not this is a private profile,
i.e. not public like AWS/Azure/Oracle/Google, etc. If private, it can only be available for
creating connections if correct permissions are granted.

privateUserEmails.description:
An array of users email ids who have permission to access this
service profile. Argument is required when profile is set as private.

profileStatuschangeNotifications.description:
A list of email addresses that will receive
notifications about profile status changes.

redundancyRequired.description:
Boolean value that determines if your connections will require
redundancy. if yes, then users need to create a secondary redundant connection.

secondaryVlanFromPrimary.description:
Indicates whether the VLAN ID of. the secondary
connection is the same as the primary connection.

servicekeyAutogenerated.description:
Boolean value that indicates whether multiple connections
can be created with the same authorization key to connect to this service profile after the first
connection has been approved by the seller.

speedBands.description:
One or more definitions of supported speed/bandwidth. Argument is
required when `speed_from_api` is set to `false`. See Speed Band below for more
details.

speedCustomizationAllowed.description:

to enter a custom connection speed.

speedFromApi.description:

from an API call. Argument has to be specified when `api_integration` is enabled.

notifications about connections approvals and rejections.

equinix:index/metalBGPSession:MetalBGPSe.description:
Provides a resource to manage BGP sessions in Equinix Metal Host. Refer to [Equinix Metal BGP documentation](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/local-global-bgp/) for more details.

You need to have BGP config enabled in your project.

BGP session must be linked to a device running [BIRD](https://bird.network.cz) or other BGP routing daemon which will control route advertisements via the session to Equinix Metal's upstream routers.

defaultRoute.description: Boolean flag to set the default route policy. False by default.

deviceId.description: ID of device.

status.description: Status of the session - up or down

defaultRoute.description: Boolean flag to set the default route policy. False by default.

deviceId.description: ID of device.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering MetalBGPSession resources.

defaultRoute.description: Boolean flag to set the default route policy. False by default.

deviceId.description: ID of device.

status.description: Status of the session - up or down

facility.description: Facility where the connection will be created.

metro.description: Metro where the connection will be created.

mode.description: Mode for connections in IBX facilities with the dedicated type - standard or tunnel. Default is standard.

organizationId.description: ID of the organization where the connection is scoped to.

ports.description:
List of connection ports - primary (`ports[0]`) and secondary (`ports[1]`). Schema of
port is described in documentation of the
equinix.MetalConnection datasource.

projectId.description: ID of the project where the connection is scoped to, must be set for.

serviceTokenType.description: Only used with shared connection. Type of service token to use for the connection, a_side or z_side.

serviceTokens.description: List of connection service tokens with attributes. Scehma of service_token is described in documentation of the equinix.MetalConnection datasource.

status.description: Status of the connection resource.

token.deprecationMessage: token is deprecated. Use service_tokens instead

vlans.description: Only used with shared connection. Vlans to attach. Pass one vlan for Primary/Single connection and two vlans for Redundant connection.

facility.description: Facility where the connection will be created.

metro.description: Metro where the connection will be created.

mode.description: Mode for connections in IBX facilities with the dedicated type - standard or tunnel. Default is standard.

organizationId.description: ID of the organization where the connection is scoped to.

projectId.description: ID of the project where the connection is scoped to, must be set for.

serviceTokenType.description: Only used with shared connection. Type of service token to use for the connection, a_side or z_side.

vlans.description: Only used with shared connection. Vlans to attach. Pass one vlan for Primary/Single connection and two vlans for Redundant connection.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering MetalConnection resources.

metro.description: Metro where the connection will be created.

List of connection ports - primary (`ports[0]`) and secondary (`ports[1]`). Schema of
port is described in documentation of the
equinix.MetalConnection datasource.

serviceTokenType.description: Only used with shared connection. Type of service token to use for the connection, a_side or z_side.

status.description: Status of the connection resource.

token.deprecationMessage: token is deprecated. Use service_tokens instead

vlans.description: Only used with shared connection. Vlans to attach. Pass one vlan for Primary/Single connection and two vlans for Redundant connection.

accessPrivateIpv4.description: The ipv4 private IP assigned to the device.

accessPublicIpv4.description: The ipv4 maintenance IP assigned to the device.

accessPublicIpv6.description: The ipv6 maintenance IP assigned to the device.

alwaysPxe.description:
If true, a device with OS `custom_ipxe` will continue to boot via iPXE
on reboots.

created.description: The timestamp for when the device was created.

customData.description: A string of the desired Custom Data for the device.

deployedFacility.description: The facility where the device is deployed.

deployedHardwareReservationId.description:
ID of hardware reservation where this device was deployed.
It is useful when using the `next-available` hardware reservation.

facilities.description:
List of facility codes with deployment preferences. Equinix Metal API will go
through the list and will deploy your device to first facility with free capacity. List items must
be facility codes or `any` (a wildcard). To find the facility code, visit
[Facilities API docs](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/api/facilities/), set your API auth
token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response. Conflicts with `metro`.

forceDetachVolumes.description:
Delete device even if it has volumes attached. Only applies
for destroy action.

hardwareReservationId.description:
The UUID of the hardware reservation where you want this device deployed, or next-available if you want to pick your
next available reservation automatically

hostname.description:
The device hostname used in deployments taking advantage of Layer3 DHCP
or metadata service configuration.

ipAddresses.description:
A list of IP address types for the device. See
IP address below for more details.

ipxeScriptUrl.description:
URL pointing to a hosted iPXE script. More information is in the
[Custom iPXE](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/servers/custom-ipxe/) doc.

metro.description: Metro area for the new device. Conflicts with `facilities`.

networkType.description:
(Deprecated) Network type of a device, used in
[Layer 2 networking](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/layer2/). Since this
attribute is deprecated you should handle Network Type with one of
equinix_metal_port,
equinix.MetalDeviceNetworkType resources or
equinix.MetalPort datasource.
See network_types guide for more info.
networkType.deprecationMessage: You should handle Network Type with one of 'equinix_metal_port' or 'equinix_metal_device_network_type' resources. See section 'Guides' for more info

networks.description:
The device's private and public IP (v4 and v6) network details. See
Network Attribute below for more details.

operatingSystem.description:
The operating system slug. To find the slug, or visit
[Operating Systems API docs](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/api/operatingsystems), set your
API auth token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response.

plan.description:
The device plan slug. To find the plan slug, visit
[Device plans API docs](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/api/plans), set your auth token in the
top of the page and see JSON from the API response.

ports.description:
List of ports assigned to the device. See Ports Attribute below for
more details.

projectId.description: The ID of the project in which to create the device

projectSshKeyIds.description:
Array of IDs of the project SSH keys which should be added to the device.
If you omit this, SSH keys of all the members of the parent project will be added to the device. If
you specify this array, only the listed project SSH keys will be added. Project SSH keys can be
created with the equinix.MetalProjectSSHKey resource.

reinstall.description:
Whether the device should be reinstalled instead of destroyed when
modifying user_data, custom_data, or operating system. See Reinstall below for more
details.

rootPassword.description: Root password to the server (disabled after 24 hours).

sshKeyIds.description: List of IDs of SSH keys deployed in the device, can be both user and project SSH keys.

storage.description:
JSON for custom partitioning. Only usable on reserved hardware. More
information in in the
[Custom Partitioning and RAID](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/servers/custom-partitioning-raid/)
doc. Please note that the disks.partitions.size attribute must be a string, not an integer. It can
be a number string, or size notation string, e.g. "4G" or "8M" (for gigabytes and megabytes).

terminationTime.description:
Timestamp for device termination. For example `2021-09-03T16:32:00+03:00`.
If you don't supply timezone info, timestamp is assumed to be in UTC.

updated.description: The timestamp for the last time the device was updated.

userData.description: A string of the desired User Data for the device.

userSshKeyIds.description: Array of IDs of the user SSH keys which should be added to the device. If you omit this, SSH keys of all the members of the parent project will be added to the device. If you specify this array, only the listed user SSH keys (and any project_ssh_key_ids) will be added. User SSH keys can be created with the equinix.MetalSSHKey resource

waitForReservationDeprovision.description:
Only used for devices in reserved hardware. If
set, the deletion of this device will block until the hardware reservation is marked provisionable
(about 4 minutes in August 2019).

alwaysPxe.description:
If true, a device with OS `custom_ipxe` will continue to boot via iPXE
on reboots.

customData.description: A string of the desired Custom Data for the device.

List of facility codes with deployment preferences. Equinix Metal API will go

alwaysPxe.description:

on reboots.

created.description: The timestamp for when the device was created.

deployedFacility.description: The facility where the device is deployed.

deployedHardwareReservationId.description:
ID of hardware reservation where this device was deployed.
It is useful when using the `next-available` hardware reservation.

facilities.description:
List of facility codes with deployment preferences. Equinix Metal API will go
through the list and will deploy your device to first facility with free capacity. List items must
be facility codes or `any` (a wildcard). To find the facility code, visit
[Facilities API docs](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/api/facilities/), set your API auth
token in the top of the page and see JSON from the API response. Conflicts with `metro`.

forceDetachVolumes.description:
Delete device even if it has volumes attached. Only applies
for destroy action.

hardwareReservationId.description:
The UUID of the hardware reservation where you want this device deployed, or next-available if you want to pick your
next available reservation automatically

hostname.description:
The device hostname used in deployments taking advantage of Layer3 DHCP
or metadata service configuration.

A list of IP address types for the device. See
IP address below for more details.

ipxeScriptUrl.description:
URL pointing to a hosted iPXE script. More information is in the
[Custom iPXE](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/servers/custom-ipxe/) doc.

metro.description: Metro area for the new device. Conflicts with `facilities`.

networkType.description:
(Deprecated) Network type of a device, used in
[Layer 2 networking](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/layer2/). Since this
attribute is deprecated you should handle Network Type with one of
equinix_metal_port,
equinix.MetalDeviceNetworkType resources or
equinix.MetalPort datasource.
See network_types guide for more info.

[Operating Systems API docs](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/api/operatingsystems), set your

plan.description:
The device plan slug. To find the plan slug, visit

List of ports assigned to the device. See Ports Attribute below for

projectSshKeyIds.description:
Array of IDs of the project SSH keys which should be added to the device.
If you omit this, SSH keys of all the members of the parent project will be added to the device. If
you specify this array, only the listed project SSH keys will be added. Project SSH keys can be
created with the equinix.MetalProjectSSHKey resource.

reinstall.description:
Whether the device should be reinstalled instead of destroyed when
modifying user_data, custom_data, or operating system. See Reinstall below for more
details.

rootPassword.description: Root password to the server (disabled after 24 hours).

sshKeyIds.description: List of IDs of SSH keys deployed in the device, can be both user and project SSH keys.

storage.description:
JSON for custom partitioning. Only usable on reserved hardware. More
information in in the
[Custom Partitioning and RAID](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/servers/custom-partitioning-raid/)
doc. Please note that the disks.partitions.size attribute must be a string, not an integer. It can
be a number string, or size notation string, e.g. "4G" or "8M" (for gigabytes and megabytes).

terminationTime.description:
Timestamp for device termination. For example `2021-09-03T16:32:00+03:00`.
If you don't supply timezone info, timestamp is assumed to be in UTC.

userSshKeyIds.description: Array of IDs of the user SSH keys which should be added to the device. If you omit this, SSH keys of all the members of the parent project will be added to the device. If you specify this array, only the listed user SSH keys (and any project_ssh_key_ids) will be added. User SSH keys can be created with the equinix.MetalSSHKey resource

equinix:index/metalIPAttachment:MetalIPA.description:
Provides a resource to attach elastic IP subnets to devices.

To attach an IP subnet from a reserved block to a provisioned device, you must derive a subnet CIDR
belonging to one of your reserved blocks in the same project and facility as the target device.

For example, you have reserved IPv4 address block `147.229.10.152/30`, you can choose to assign
either the whole block as one subnet to a device; or 2 subnets with CIDRs `147.229.10.152/31` and
`147.229.10.154/31`; or 4 subnets with mask prefix length `32`. More about the elastic IP subnets
is [here](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/elastic-ips/).

Device and reserved block must be in the same facility.

addressFamily.description: Address family as integer. One of `4` or `6`.

cidr.description: Length of CIDR prefix of the subnet as integer.

cidrNotation.description:
CIDR notation of subnet from block reserved in the same project
and facility as the device.

deviceId.description: ID of device to which to assign the subnet.

gateway.description: IP address of gateway for the subnet.

global.description: Flag indicating whether IP block is global, i.e. assignable in any location

netmask.description: Subnet mask in decimal notation, e.g., `255.255.255.0`.

public.description: Boolean flag whether subnet is reachable from the Internet.

cidrNotation.description:
CIDR notation of subnet from block reserved in the same project
and facility as the device.

deviceId.description: ID of device to which to assign the subnet.

`user_ssh_keys`, `userdata`, `customdata`, `ipxe_script_url`, `tags`. You can find each parameter
description in equinix.MetalDevice docs.

On resource destruction wait until devices are removed.

equinix:index/metalVRF:MetalVRF.description:
Use this resource to manage a VRF.

> VRF features are not generally available. The interfaces related to VRF resources may change ahead of general availability.


## Import

This resource can be imported using an existing VRF ID

```sh
 $ pulumi import equinix:index/metalVRF:MetalVRF equinix_metal_vrf {existing_id}
```

ipRanges.description: All IPv4 and IPv6 Ranges that will be available to BGP Peers. IPv4 addresses must be /8 or smaller with a minimum size of /29. IPv6 must be /56 or smaller with a minimum size of /64. Ranges must not overlap other ranges within the VRF.

metro.description: Metro ID or Code where the VRF will be deployed.

name.description: User-supplied name of the VRF, unique to the project

projectId.description: Project ID where the VRF will be deployed.

subnet.description:
A subnet from one of the IP
blocks associated with the VRF that we will help create an IP reservation for. Can only be either a /30 or /31.
* For a /31 block, it will only have two IP addresses, which will be used for
the metal_ip and customer_ip.
* For a /30 block, it will have four IP addresses, but the first and last IP addresses are not usable. We will default to the first usable IP address for the metal_ip.

equinix:index/networkSSHKey:NetworkSSHKe.description:
Resource `equinix.NetworkSSHKey` allows creation and management of Equinix Network Edge SSH keys.


## Import

This resource can be imported using an existing ID

```sh

```

deviceId.description: UUID of device occupying the reservation.

provisionable.description:
Flag indicating whether the reserved server is provisionable or not. Spare
devices can't be provisioned unless they are activated first.

spare.description:
Flag indicating whether the Hardware Reservation is a spare. Spare Hardware
Reservations are used when a Hardware Reservations requires service from Metal Equinix.

switchUuid.description:
Switch short ID, can be used to determine if two devices are connected to the
same switch.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetMetalIPBlockRanges.

Facility code filtering the IP blocks. Global IPv4 blcoks will be listed
anyway. If you omit this and metro, all the block from the project will be listed.

metro.description:
Metro code filtering the IP blocks. Global IPv4 blcoks will be listed
anyway. If you omit this and facility, all the block from the project will be listed.

projectId.description: ID of the project from which to list the blocks.

globalIpv4s.description: list of CIDR expressions for Global IPv4 blocks in the project.

ipv6s.description: list of CIDR expressions for IPv6 blocks in the project.

privateIpv4s.description: list of CIDR expressions for Private IPv4 blocks in the project.

publicIpv4s.description: list of CIDR expressions for Public IPv4 blocks in the project.

equinix:index/getMetalPrecreatedIPBlock:.description:
Use this data source to get CIDR expression for precreated IPv6 and IPv4 blocks in Equinix Metal.
You can then use the cidrsubnet TF builtin function to derive subnets.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetMetalPrecreatedIPBlock.

addressFamily.description: 4 or 6, depending on which block you are looking for.

facility.description: Facility of the searched block. (for non-global blocks).

global.description: Whether to look for global block. Default is false for backward compatibility.

metro.description: Metro of the searched block (for non-global blocks).

projectId.description: ID of the project where the searched block should be.

public.description: Whether to look for public or private block.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetMetalPrecreatedIPBlock.

cidrNotation.description: CIDR notation of the looked up block.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

backendTransfer.description: Whether Backend Transfer is enabled for this project.

bgpConfigs.description: Optional BGP settings. Refer to [Equinix Metal guide for BGP](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/local-global-bgp/).

created.description: The timestamp for when the project was created.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

paymentMethodId.description: The UUID of payment method for this project.

updated.description: The timestamp for the last time the project was updated.

userIds.description: List of UUIDs of user accounts which belong to this project.

in the Equinix Metal project.

equinix:index/getMetalReservedIPBlock:Ge.description:
Use this data source to find IP address blocks in Equinix Metal. You can use IP address or a block
ID for lookup.

> VRF features are not generally available. The interfaces related to VRF resources may change ahead of general availability.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetMetalReservedIPBlock.

ipAddress.description: Block containing this IP address will be returned.

projectId.description: UUID of the project where the searched block should be.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetMetalReservedIPBlock.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetMetalVRF.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

ipRanges.description: All IPv4 and IPv6 Ranges that will be available to BGP Peers. IPv4 addresses must be /8 or smaller with a minimum size of /29. IPv6 must be /56 or smaller with a minimum size of /64. Ranges must not overlap other ranges within the VRF.

localAsn.description: The 4-byte ASN set on the VRF.

metro.description: Metro ID or Code where the VRF will be deployed.

name.description: User-supplied name of the VRF, unique to the project

projectId.description: Project ID where the VRF will be deployed.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetMetalVirtualCircuit.

virtualCircuitId.description: ID of the virtual circuit resource

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetMetalVirtualCircuit.

connectionId.description: UUID of Connection where the VC is scoped to.

customerIp.description: The Customer IP address which the CSR switch will peer with. Will default to the other usable IP in the subnet.

description.description: Description for the Virtual Circuit resource.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

md5.description: The password that can be set for the VRF BGP peer

metalIp.description: The Metal IP address for the SVI (Switch Virtual Interface) of the VirtualCircuit. Will default to the first usable IP in the subnet.

name.description: Name of the virtual circuit resource.

peerAsn.description: The BGP ASN of the peer. The same ASN may be the used across several VCs, but it cannot be the same as the local_asn of the VRF.

portId.description: UUID of the Connection Port where the VC is scoped to.

projectId.description:
ID of project to which the VC belongs.
* `vnid`, `nni_vlan`, `nni_nvid` - VLAN parameters, see the
[documentation for Equinix Fabric](https://metal.equinix.com/developers/docs/networking/fabric/).

speed.description: Speed of the Virtual Circuit resource.

status.description: Status of the virtal circuit.

subnet.description:
A subnet from one of the IP
blocks associated with the VRF that we will help create an IP reservation for. Can only be either a /30 or /31.
* For a /31 block, it will only have two IP addresses, which will be used for
the metal_ip and customer_ip.
* For a /30 block, it will have four IP addresses, but the first and last IP addresses are not usable. We will default to the first usable IP address for the metal_ip.

tags.description: Tags for the Virtual Circuit resource.

vrfId.description: UUID of the VLAN to associate.

vxlan.description: vxlan number of the VLAN to look up. Use together with the project_id and metro or facility.

assignedDevicesIds.description: List of device ID to which this VLAN is assigned.

description.description: Description text of the VLAN resource.

Account status for filtering. Possible values are: `Active`, `Processing`,
`Submitted`, `Staged`.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetNetworkDevice.

name.description: Name of an existing Equinix Network Edge device

uuid.description: UUID of an existing Equinix Network Edge device

validStatusList.description: Device states to be considered valid when searching for a device by name

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetNetworkDevice.

aclTemplateId.description: Unique identifier of applied ACL template

ibx.description: Device location Equinix Business Exchange name

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

interfaces.description:
List of device interfaces
* `interface.#.id` - interface identifier
* `interface.#.name` - interface name
* `interface.#.status` -  interface status (AVAILABLE, RESERVED, ASSIGNED)
* `interface.#.operational_status` - interface operational status (up or down)
* `interface.#.mac_address` - interface MAC address
* `interface.#.ip_address` - interface IP address
* `interface.#.assigned_type` - interface management type (Equinix Managed or empty)
* `interface.#.type` - interface type

licenseFileId.description: Unique identifier of applied license file

licenseStatus.description:
Device license registration status
* APPLYING_LICENSE
* REGISTERED
* APPLIED
* WAITING_FOR_CLUSTER_SETUP
* REGISTRATION_FAILED

redundancyType.description:
Device redundancy type applicable for HA devices, either
primary or secondary

redundantId.description: Unique identifier for a redundant device applicable for HA devices

sshIpAddress.description: IP address of SSH enabled interface on the device

sshIpFqdn.description: FQDN of SSH enabled interface on the device

status.description:
Device provisioning status
* INITIALIZING
* PROVISIONING
* PROVISIONED  (**NOTE: By default data source will only return devices in this state.  To include other states see `valid_state_list`**)
* WAITING_FOR_PRIMARY
* WAITING_FOR_SECONDARY
* WAITING_FOR_REPLICA_CLUSTER_NODES
* CLUSTER_SETUP_IN_PROGRESS
* FAILED
* DEPROVISIONING
* DEPROVISIONED

validStatusList.description: Comma separated list of device states (from see `status` for full list) to be considered valid. Default is 'PROVISIONED'.  Case insensitive.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetNetworkDevicePlatform.

coreCount.description: Number of CPU cores used to limit platform search results.

flavor.description:
Device platform flavor that determines number of CPU cores and memory.
Supported values are: `small`, `medium`, `large`, `xlarge`.

licenseOptions.description:
List of device licensing options to limit platform search result.
Supported values are: `BYOL` (for Bring Your Own License), `Sub` (for license subscription).

managementTypes.description:
List of device management types to limit platform search results.
Supported values are: `EQUINIX-CONFIGURED`, `SELF-CONFIGURED`.

packages.description: List of software package codes to limit platform search results.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetNetworkDevicePlatform.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

memory.description: The amount of memory provided by device platform.

memoryUnit.description: Unit of memory provider by device platform.

mostRecent.description:
Boolean value to indicate that most recent version should be used *(in
case when more than one result is returned)*.

packages.description:
Limits returned versions to those that are supported by given software
package codes.

stable.description: Boolean value to limit query results to stable versions only.

versionRegex.description:
A regex string to apply on returned versions and filter search
results.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

status.description: Version status.
